name: Cofresi Palm Beach & Spa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe you are like me and read the wildly different reviews and wondered “can people really have such different experiences staying at the very same hotel?!?” Hopefully, this review will help you to determine what the strengths and faults of this hotel are and how to have the best experience possible.
reviews.title: LOVELY RESORT - GOOD VALUE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little background: I was traveling with my husband and another couple. This is my third time to the area, 5th time to the DR (we have also visited Punta Cana and La Romana). We have stayed at 4-star facilities and mid-grade hotels at various locations. We have traveled extensively in the Caribbean and are very familiar with the area. I am also a firm believer in treating people with kindness and consideration – it always pays off, especially when traveling in the DR. So here it goes!
reviews.title: Great Resort With A Few Negatives

reviews.text: CHECK-IN:
reviews.title: Dreadful, oppressive and loud. But cheap.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say that contrary to many of the reviews, our check-in could not have been easier. Based on the reviews, I knew to request rooms in the 40-43 buildings. We arrived at the hotel at 12 and when reiterating our request for the specific room, we were told that they would happily accommodate that but that the room wouldn’t be ready until 3 (which was expected). Our friends also were able to get their room in the same block of buildings and after eating lunch and looking around, we were able to check in at 3 without a problem at all. The front desk was very friendly and accommodating and I really had no complaints.
reviews.title: Excellent Trip- Beautiful Resort!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS:
reviews.title: Not As Advertised

reviews.text: Beautiful resort, beach is clean and staff are super friendly! Great experience. Entertainment staff - Spaghetti and babyFace were amazing hosts - only detractor was food was average and room were small in older villas.
reviews.title: Good first experience in Dominican Republic

reviews.text: Very lively resort, we stayed very close to the beach, so we could hear disco music every day. The room was very bright and clean. The beach was average. The main buffets were pretty good, fresh and a good selection. The beach buffet needs to be improved. We had Indian at the a la carte which made me violently ill. I couldnt leave the room and had to send family members to get food the following day. The management had the take-out containers and would write the room# on them and escort my family down with them. It was a pain. Also, the alcohol is sub-standard all the bottles were named "Royal" and the tequila did not taste like tequila at all. But overall. the staff were excellent and tried very hard.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Rooms Lots of Steps

reviews.text: This resort is beautiful, I loved every second of it! The food was amazing, and ill never forget the people we met. Banana, spaghetti, Bon Jovi, mosquito, blackie and baby face! These boys made the trip fun and exciting. The weather was great and ill never forget it. Lots of fun activities and the a la carte's were fantastic. Mmm migusta senior!
reviews.title: BEST TRIP OF MY LIFE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from spending a vacation at the lifesyles / Cofresi Palms resort.
reviews.title: Lilo Tennis Pro

reviews.text: I will skip the usual review of the resort as it was not the highlight for us.
reviews.title: Excellent time in the confresi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased the Groupon deal for $350 All Inclusive for 5 days, 4 nights. You are only given one night at a restaurant. You can TRY to get another night but they always say its full (not true). The rooms are HORRIBLE!!! We felt the springs in the bed, the shower was broken, the floors were chipped, but it was clean. We only had wash clothes one day. The food at the buffet is just OK. The restaurant food wasn't much better. If you are going for the pool, sun and booze, then do it, but if you are looking for a nice place and good food, don't. The help there is amazing and very nice, but it is true that they really try to get you to buy a time share. They ask everyday more then once to take you on a tour. Oh and one last thing, the people that had the groupon called the rooms we stayed in "the ghetto" of the resort.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Lifestyles Resort In the past and so we knew that if we didn't enjoy Cofresi we could spend our time at the adjoining resort. There was no need. Cofresi is a beautiful resort. There are several pools so finding a quiet place to bask in the sun and swim was not difficult. Having access to the Lifestyles Resort gives the option of eating at either of the two buffets and several restaurants. My in-laws had difficulty with all the stairs so they often walked over to the Lifestyles Resort to eat but I enjoyed the exercise since I tend to overeat at a resort anyway. My only complaints were that the decorative bedding was dirty and that the resort was packed. Being such a sprawling resort with so many guests there were often long lines for food and we couldn't get into the restaurants we wanted for dinner. That though could be remedied by not going during their busiest season.
reviews.title: Great Resort If You Don't Mind The Exercise

reviews.text: There were so many restaraunts with very good food choices the mexican and asaian were my favorite for dinner,. The buffets the pearl and casalbanca wer every gd everyday with different food choices the food service manager Brain was very helpfuil and went above and beyond daily to make sure we had anything we wanted.
reviews.title: Food

reviews.text: First time in the Dominican Republic, stayed at the Cofresi with my wife and our two boys and we were all pleasantly surprised! Beautiful resort, friendly and accommodating staff. I would recommend the up-grade to a junior suite, they are new or have recently been renovated...we were in a standard room and it was a disappointment.
reviews.title: |Great time at Cofresi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was okay .The kids had a blast, we all had a wonderful vacation.Would definitely return!!
reviews.title: Not as advertised

reviews.text: Cofresi Palm is a 3.5 star resort in my opinion. We had a fun time with our family of 4 and enjoyed the beautiful weather. Facility is well maintained with many employees on staff cleaning every day. Check in staff could use some "people skills" but overall had a fun time. Super Tino was very entertaining and my children truly enjoyed him. Don't get sucked into the VIP "hype"..extra money for not much in return. Beware of the "vacation share" speel that they will do anything to expose you to. Welcome party Sunday night was fabulous and the highlight of our stay. Probably will not return to this location.
reviews.title: Family Spring Break 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival the desk help was not welcoming or helpful. I should have known immediately by receiving Old, reused bedroom keys that were so worn that we couldnt even get in our room and had to walk almost 10 min up 6 flights of stairs back to get a "not soo used" card that was still readable. Gross! The bathroom had all reused, half full and worn out labels, complimentary lotion, shampoo, etc. ! Totally unsanitary! The accomidations were below average to say the least. Our electric went out about every two hours in the room. And if that wasnt enough i got food poisoning the 2nd day in. Spent my birthday in the 24 hour emergency hospital room receiving an IV and medicine which was lucky enough on the resort. That is the only positive of the whole resort. At one buffet a "chef" would freshly cook you pasta and fresh vegetables, however if you got a "lazy" non english speaking worker they would only offer you the left over already cooked sitting food. So this place is not Vegetarian friendly. But receiving food poisoning at this point doesnt surprise me. In a nut shell, Spend a few more dollars and go ANYWHERE else than this disgusting resort.
reviews.title: Do Not Go to the Confresi Palm in Punta Cana!

reviews.text: So, I booked this through Groupon, so it is probably important to keep that in perspective. Our rooms were really disappointing - my bathroom was dirty and the handle was broken. There was hair on the floor and the shower was disgusting. I had to call maid service to clean it within five minutes of being there. They never fixed the handle the entire time either. I had an adjoining room with a friend, and her bathroom had been remodeled, but mine had not. The sheets and bedspread were stained with dirt as well.
reviews.title: Activities great, hotel room - not so much

reviews.text: The pools and activities were good though. I was thrown off by the entertainment guys coming up to ask and asking us to write review and mention their names (apparently they get bonused if we do). They literally wanted to hand me a computer to write the review. But - the late night entertainment was really fun and made us laugh (some beacuse of how odd it was). We, like many others, were made aware many times we weren't VIPS, and a lot of the resort is not accessible to those who aren't.
reviews.title: I love my new nickname; chicken legs!

reviews.text: The THursday night party was really great and fun...Vegas style can't be beat...
reviews.title: Don't see why this place has bad reviews.

description: Cofresi Palm Beach & Spa Resort – Dominican Republic is the newest jewel in the Lifestyle Holidays Vacation Club. Nestled along the Cofresi beach shores, and overlooking the sparkling Caribbean sea, this resort caters to the luxurious enjoyment of both families and couples looking for that perfect getaway. With 468 well-appointed accommodations that range from Adult Only Spa Suites, to Standard family friendly rooms located in a quite setting between the ocean beach and spectacular pool, this is a paradise worthy of the Lifestyle name. The resort was created with space and comfort in mind, making Cofresi Palm a relaxing, enjoyable and satisfying experience for all guests and their families. All rooms have air conditioning, cable television, phones, and ceiling fans, while the decor has a distinctive design, featuring dark wood furnishings. Shaded patios and verandas provide a relaxing place to gather in some of the units. Providing both service and features that are standard for a Lifestyle property, the Cofresi Palm offers a unique luxury accommodations experience. Cofresi Palm provides the easy, relaxed ambiance of the Caribbean in an opulent and elegant setting. Experience the array of beauty and excitement that Cofresi Palm Beach & Spa Resort has to offer.
